result.execSummary:
The defendant Henry D Lange was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:42 PM Prosecuting attorney Kevin R. Calkins appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Henry D Lange appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Melville Peter Middleton II appeared in court for Henry D Lange. Agreement recited by State. Right to preliminary hearing recited to defendant. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Information filed, reading waived. Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Sentencing statements. Court sentenced the defendant to serve 10 months in jail, consecutive to any other sentence currently serving, this is with Huber. Submit DNA sample. $518.00 costs. Sixty days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. 112 days sentence credit. Starts forthwith. 3:59 PM
Appointed Attorney Peter Middleton

Order to Withdraw re: Atty Yang

3:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Kevin R. Calkins appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Henry D Lange appeared in court, in custody of Columbia County Jail, Attorney Michael Yang appeared by video for Henry D Lange. Attorney Yang stated he filed a motion to withdraw prior to court, requested it be addressed at this time. Stated the defendant did call him the other day and requested that he stay on the case instead. Attorney Yang continue in his request to withdraw. Court questioned the defendant. Granted the motion to withdraw, signed the order. Attorney Yang will notify the SPD office, released from hearing. Defendant requested to proceed with sentencing prose. Discussion by court and defendant. Defendant withdrew his request to proceed prose. There has been no preliminary hearing or waiver filed in this case. 3:50 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 3, 2021 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant appeared on a warrant. Statement by Atty Edwards. Statement by defendant. Waived reading of complaint. Right to atty recited. $500.00 cash bond. Standard felony conditions.
